{{orphan|date=January 2010}}
{{expert-subject|Cricket|date=January 2010}} {{Infobox cricket tournament | name = 2010 Indian Premier League | image = | imagesize = | caption = | administrator = [[Board of Control for Cricket in India|BCCI]] | cricket format = [[Twenty20]] | tournament format = [[Round-robin tournament|Double round-robin]] and [[Single-elimination tournament|Knockout]] | host = [[India]] | champions = TBD | count = | participants = 8 | matches = 60 | player of the series = TBD | most runs = TBD | most wickets = TBD | website = [http://www.iplt20.com/ www.iplt20.com] | previous_year = 2009 | previous_tournament = 2009 Indian Premier League }}
The 2010 Player Auction for [[Indian Premier League]] was held on the 19th January 2010. It was held in India. 97 players from cricket playing countries other than India had registered for the auction. However 66 players were selected for the final auction.
The auction list featured players from Australia (11), South Africa (9), Sri Lanka (8), West Indies (8), Pakistan (7), New Zealand (4) and one each from Bangladesh, Canada, Holland and Zimbabwe.
However in the final auction, only 14 players were sold which included players like [[Kieron Pollard]], who was sold to [[Mumbai Indians]] for a whopping [[INR]] 12.6 crores after the tie breaker.
As no Pakistani player was selected, a lot of controversy was generated in the media. The teams stated that as the players would not be fully available for the 3rd IPL edition, they weren't interested to buy them.
